title: 5'_to_3'_RNA_Molecule OWL class
body:
```
I would like to ask which class in the OWL ontology corresponds to the 
5'_to_3'_RNA_Molecule entity that is formalised in the paper? The OWL classes 
are encoded in the format "RNA0_ "+7-digit number.

Thanks,
Despoina

```

Original issue reported on code.google.com by `magka...@gmail.com` on 23 Jan 2012 at 10:57

title: Unescaped quotes in `rnao.obo`
body:
Hi !

Following the [discussion about the status of the RNAO project](https://github.com/OBOFoundry/OBOFoundry.github.io/issues/867) we figured out it would be a good idea to report the possible errors in RNAO files.

`rnao.obo` contains several unescaped quotes in quoted strings, such as:
```ini
def: "A family_11_base_pair is an RNAO_base_pair in which two RNA nucleotides interact by edge-to-edge hydrogen-bonding between the Sugar edges of each base and in which the glycosidic bonds of the two nucleotides are oriented "cis" relative to each other." [RNAO:ROC]
```

The offenders:
* `"cis"`
* `"trans"`
* `"hairpin loop"`

title: Unreachable RO import caused by outdated URL
body:
Hi!

The URL used to access the RO uses a direct link to the obofoundry (`http://www.obofoundry.org/ro/ro.owl`), which results in a 404 error when trying to reach it. The new obolibrary PURL should be used instead (`http://purl.obolibrary.org/obo/ro.owl`).

title: Duplicate annotations in `rnao.owl`
body:
Hi!

`rnao.owl` contains multiple occurrences of tags that should be unique:
* in `RNAO:1000308`, multiple `rdfs:comment`
* in `RNAO:0000000`, multiple `rdfs:comment`
* in `RNAO:0000059`, multiple `rdfs:label`

This causes ROBOT to fail when it tries to load the `rnao.owl` product.

title: Typedefs imported from RO should be refered to using xrefs
body:
Hi!

The OBO semantics describes the following procedure to use local names for RO (and BFO) relationships:
1. Declare a local typedef with an unprefixed ID
2. Add an xref to the actual RO typedef

So for instance the following frame from `rnao.obo`:
```ini
[Typedef]
id: ro.owl#has_quality
name: has quality
```
should instead be declared
```ini
[Typedef]
id: has_quality
xref: RO:has_quality
```

See the OBO semantics section [5.9.3](http://owlcollab.github.io/oboformat/doc/obo-syntax.html#5.9.3) and [8.2.2](http://owlcollab.github.io/oboformat/doc/obo-syntax.html#8.2.2) for more information about this mechanism.

title: Make `RNAO:1000300` obsolete
body:
Hi!

Since the last release, ChEBI has added more chemicals, and `RNAO:1000300` (*carboxamidine*) is now available as [`CHEBI:35359`](https://www.ebi.ac.uk/chebi/searchId.do?chebiId=CHEBI:35359).

title: Add obofoundry topic to repo metadata
body: The OBO Foundry has recently created a topics page at https://github.com/topics/obofoundry. It would be great if you could add the `obofoundry` topic to your repository, since it's currently listed as active in the OBO Foundry. If you're not sure how to do that, follow the instructions [here](https://docs.github.com/en/github/administering-a-repository/managing-repository-settings/classifying-your-repository-with-topics).   The main issue for this task is at https://github.com/OBOFoundry/OBOFoundry.github.io/issues/1538 in case you want some more context or to join the larger discussion.
